linkjvm.libkovan

Class AnalogSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • linkjvm.libkovan.Sensor
      • linkjvm.libkovan.AnalogSensor

  • public class AnalogSensor
extends Sensor
    An instance of this class is used to control one analog sensor on the specified sensor port.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Markus Klein

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class linkjvm.libkovan.Sensor

        A_BUTTON, B_BUTTON, sensorPort, SIDE_BUTTON

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AnalogSensor(int sensorPort)
      Creates a new analog sensor on the specified port.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getValue()
      Returns the sensor value as 10 bit number(from 0 to 1023).
      short getValue8()
      Returns the sensor value as 8 bit number(from 0 to 255).
      void setPullup(int pullup)
      The analog sensor ports on the KIPR Link provides a pullup sensor for sensor that don�t have an integrated pullup resistor.

      • Methods inherited from class linkjvm.libkovan.Sensor

        getButtonPressed, getPort, setPort

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnalogSensor

        public AnalogSensor(int sensorPort)
        Creates a new analog sensor on the specified port. The invocation AnalogSensor sensor = new AnalogSensor(0) is equivalent to: AnalogSensor sensor = new AnalogSensor(); sensor.setPort(0);
        Parameters:
        sensorPort - the port of the analog sensor

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Returns the sensor value as 10 bit number(from 0 to 1023).
        Specified by:
        getValue in class Sensor
        Returns:
        the current sensor value

      • getValue8

        public short getValue8()
        Returns the sensor value as 8 bit number(from 0 to 255).
        Returns:
        the current sensor value

      • setPullup

        public void setPullup(int pullup)
        The analog sensor ports on the KIPR Link provides a pullup sensor for sensor that don�t have an integrated pullup resistor. For example, sensorInstance.setPullup(1) enables the pullup and sensorInstance.setPullup(0) diables the pullup.
        Parameters:
        pullup - pullup
